name: tea
description: A soothing cup of classic tea, perfect for a relaxing moment.
ingredient: Tea leaves or tea bags, water, sugar (optional), milk (optional)
method:
1. Boil water and pour it into a teapot.
2. Add tea leaves or tea bags to the teapot...
3. Let it steep for 3-5 minutes, depending on your preference.
4. If desired, add sugar and milk to taste.
5. Stir well and pour the tea into cups. Enjoy!

name: Delicious Chocolate Cake
description: A rich and moist chocolate cake that will satisfy your cravings.
method: Preheat oven to 350째F (175째C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla extract. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes.
Stir in boiling water (batter will be thin). Pour batter evenly into prepared pans.
Bake in preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow cakes to cool in pans for 10 minutes, then remove from pans and transfer to wire racks to cool completely.
Frost with your favorite frosting and enjoy!

name: Classic Spaghetti Bolognese
description: A hearty and flavorful Italian pasta dish with a rich meaty sauce.
method: In a large pot, brown the ground beef over medium heat. Drain excess fat.
Add chopped onion, minced garlic, grated carrot, and chopped celery. Cook until vegetables are soft.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, red wine, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer for about 30 minutes.
While the sauce simmers, cook spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Serve the sauce over cooked spaghetti and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.

name: Homestyle Chicken Pot Pie
description: A comforting and classic chicken pot pie with a flaky crust.
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cooked and diced
2 cups frozen mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, corn)
method: Preheat oven to 425째F (220째C).
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in flour, salt, pepper, and thyme until well combined.
Gradually whisk in chicken broth and milk. Cook and stir until the mixture thickens and becomes bubbly.
Add cooked chicken and frozen vegetables. Stir to combine and remove from heat.
Roll out one pie crust and place it in a 9-inch pie dish. Pour the chicken and vegetable mixture into the crust.
Roll out the second pie crust and place it over the filling. Seal and crimp the edges. Cut a few slits in the top crust for venting.
Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
Let cool for a few minutes before serving.
